title: Hamas accepts Gaza truce proposal as Israel strikes eastern Rafah
summary: Benjamin Netanyahu's office said the ceasefire proposal 'is far from Israel's essential demands', but that his government will send negotiators for talks 'to exhaust the potential for arriving at an agreement'.

title: Pro-Palestinian voices silenced in Egypt
summary: The Cairo authorities have arrested and intimidated citizens to prevent their solidarity with Gazans from evolving into a protest movement that could potentially challenge the current regime.

title: 'Welcoming Xi Jinping to France is a policy of complicity in the Uyghur genocide'
summary: Sociologist Dilnur Reyhan, a French national of Uyghur origin, calls on President Emmanuel Macron not to remain silent on Beijing's genocidal policy when hosting Xi Jinping.

title: Xi Jinping's visit to Europe: Trade disputes at the heart of EU-China exchanges
summary: The European Union has launched anti-dumping investigations into electric cars, solar panels and medical equipment to prevent China from flooding the European market with unfairly subsidized products that could undermine European competition.

title: Trump fined and threatened with jail for gag order violations
summary: Judge Juan Merchan threatened the Republican presidential candidate with incarceration if he reoffends during his New York criminal trial over hush money payments made to former adult film star Stormy Daniels.

title: Victor Wembanyama named NBA Rookie of the Year
summary: The San Antonio Spurs star was unanimously selected and became the first Frenchman to win the award.

title: Japan defends its immigration policy, amid Joe Biden's accusations of xenophobia
summary: Despite its declining population and a severe labor shortage, the country has maintained strict criteria for foreigners entering its territory.

title: Sweden's social model is on its last legs
summary: In schools, hospitals and nursing homes, employees complain of worsening working conditions. Meanwhile new budget cuts are being announced by local and regional authorities, whose deficits are exploding.

title: The mysterious €21 billion hole in France's coffers
summary: Was it a forecasting error or the inevitable consequence of tax cuts? Le Monde journalist Elsa Conesa writes about the controversy behind the size of France's public deficit.

title: Macron and von der Leyen press China's Xi on Ukraine and fair trade at Paris summit
summary: The French and EU Commission Presidents spoke to Chinese President Xi Jinping in a trilateral meeting, kicking off Xi's two-day state visit to France with discussions of 'fair rules for all' in trade, as well as China's exports to Russia during its war in Ukraine.

title: Pulitzer Prizes awarded to 'New York Times' and 'Washington Post'
summary: The Associated Press also received a Pulitzer Prize in feature photography for its coverage of global migration to the US.

title: Voter in Chad election shot dead at polling station
summary: According to Chadian election officials and local authorities, a gunman who did not have a voter card 'burst into the voting station' and, on being barred from voting, 'drew his weapon and fired' indiscriminately, killing a 65-year-old voter.

title: Columbia University cancels graduation ceremony due to Gaza protests
summary: The university, which has been rocked by pro-Palestinian student protests against Israel's actions in Gaza, has stressed in its announcement that its decision to focus on 'smaller-scale, school-based celebrations' was 'based on feedback from our students.'

title: Putin orders nuclear drills with troops near Ukraine
summary: The Russian leader made the decision in the face of Western 'threats,' as a Ukrainian drone attack killed six people and wounded over 30 in Russia's Belgorod border region.

title: Ryan Gosling falls flat on his face in 'The Fall Guy'
summary: The Canadian actor struggles to convince as a stuntman in David Leitch's film, which awkwardly mixes action with romantic comedy.

title: US Senator Bernie Sanders is running for reelection
summary: The 82-year-old liberal politican from Vermont is seeking a fourth term. He highlighted threats to democracy, wealth inequality and the Israel-Hamas war in his announcement video.

title: EU to drop rule-of-law proceedings against Poland
summary: The EU and Poland had been at odds after the Law and Justice party came to power in 2015.

title: Israel army begins partial evacuation of Rafah
summary: The Israeli army said on Monday it 'encourages' about 100,000 residents to move to an 'expanded humanitarian area' in the Palestinian territory.

title: World Bank calls to 'drastically reorient' the global agrifood system
summary: The solutions proposed by the financial institution have been deemed insufficient for moving toward a sustainable and resilient model.

title: BBC documentary on arrested Iranian woman's death angers authorities
summary: Documents revealed by the British broadcaster refute the Iranian security forces' claim that 16-year-old Nika Shakarami, who disappeared on September 20, 2022, after protesting Mahsa Amini's death, died by suicide.

title: Okinawa pays heavy toll for continued US military presence in Japan
summary: Three-quarters of the 50,000 GIs still deployed in the country are based on this archipelago, which occupies 0.6% of the country's land area.

title: Boeing investigated over possible falsified records on 787 aircraft
summary: The US Federal Aviation Administration said Monday it has opened an investigation into Boeing after the beleaguered company reported that workers at a South Carolina plant falsified inspection records on certain 787 planes.

title: Paris Olympics are prime target for cybercriminals
summary: Authorities are preparing for a multitude of informational attacks, whether carried out for financial gain or to tarnish France's image.

title: Met Gala 2024: Celebrities in full bloom on the red carpet
summary: Jennifer Lopez, Zendaya, Lana del Rey, and other A-listers donned flora and fauna-themed outfits to embody 'The Garden of Time' dress code at this year's Met Gala in New York.

title: Israeli forces take control of Gaza side of Rafah crossing with Egypt
summary: An Israeli tank brigade seized control of the Gaza Strip side of the Rafah border crossing with Egypt on Tuesday, authorities said, moving forward with an offensive in the southern city even as ceasefire negotiations with Hamas remain on a knife’s edge.

title: Panama president-elect promises to close Darien Gap migrant route
summary: Right-wing former minister José Raul Mulino, a last-minute replacement for another candidate prevented from running by the courts, won the presidential election on Sunday.

title: Trump gets prison warning as criminal trial enters third week of testimony
summary: Employees of the Trump Organization detailed how Trump hid a hush money payment of $130,000 to adult movie star Stormy Daniels before the 2016 presidential election.

title: French government launches conference to combat mounting anti-Semitism
summary: Prime Minister Gabriel Attal promised 'exemplary toughness' in combating the 'outpouring' of hatred against Jews since October 7, 2023.

title: Israel's shock Rafah offensive deals blow to ceasefire hopes
summary: The Israeli army's incursion came just hours after Hamas announced that it had accepted a ceasefire proposal from Egypt and Qatar.

title: 'Olympic truce' in Ukraine and hint of a trade battle dominate first day of Xi's visit to France
summary: On Monday, Emmanuel Macron and the Chinese president launched a joint appeal for a ceasefire in Ukraine on the occasion of the Paris Olympic Games this summer. On the trade front, little progress has been made.

title: Putin takes oath for record fifth presidential term
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin was sworn into office at a carefully choreographed lavish Kremlin ceremony for a record-breaking fifth term on Tuesday after he ousted all political opponents during elections earlier this year.

title: Immigration: Denmark again contemplates outsourcing asylum procedures to third countries
summary: Representatives of several European governments met in Denmark on Monday to discuss partnerships with third countries, with the aim of reducing immigration to Europe.

title: Rodolphe Saadé: 'China-America tensions continue unabated, even though both countries need each other'
summary: Climate, geopolitics and artificial intelligence are the challenges facing the shipping company CMA CGM in the years to come, according to its CEO, who recently inaugurated a training and innovation center in Marseille.

title: PSG - Dortmund Borussia: Paris determined to have win at home
summary: Beaten 0-1 in the first leg of the semi-final in Germany, PSG is counting on its fans to help reverse the trend on Tuesday and secure its place in the Champions League final.

title: Georgia, a dilemma and a challenge for the European Union
summary: Having granted official EU candidate status to the former South Caucasus Soviet republic in December 2023, the Georgian government's openly pro-Russian U-turn is a headache for Brussels.

title: For Denver University students, Gaza protests are all about land struggle
summary: On the Auraria campus, home to the red-brick house where former Israeli prime minister Golda Meir lived, most of the students, from modest immigrant backgrounds, identify with the Palestinian cause.

title: Met Gala 2024: How a charity dinner turned into an evening of extravaganza
summary: On Monday, the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York held its famous fund-raising dinner for the fashion department.

title: Olympic Games 2024: Ukrainian athlete Mariia Vysochanska to carry the Olympic flame in Marseille
summary: While her father fights the Russian invasion, the 21-year-old Ukrainian gymnast has been selected to be one of the athletes who will welcome the Olympic torch when it arrives in Marseille on May 8: a highly symbolic choice, and a source of pride.

title: Stormy Daniels describes first meeting Trump in hush money trial
summary: The testimony of the adult movie actress is by far the most-awaited in the hush money trial of former US President Donald Trump.

title: EU adopts its first law tackling violence against women
summary: The far-reaching law, which criminalizes everything from female genital mutilation to the non-consensual sharing of intimate images, does not include a common EU-wide definition of rape, a measure which France had opposed.

title: France denounces Iran's 'policy of state hostage-taking'
summary: In a rare statement from a Western government, France condemned Iran's taking of hostages to serve as blackmail to extract concessions from the west, including 4 French citizens, for whom the country demanded the 'immediate and unconditional release.'

title: EU elections: European scientists are worried about mounting populism
summary: A group of scientists of the European Federation of Academies of Sciences and Humanities have signed a letter calling for science and education freedom in Europe as the far right, they say, threatens the 'future of Europe.'

title: Scottish parliament names John Swinney as new leader
summary: Swinney succeeds Humza Yousaf, who announced his resignation last week after just over a year in charge.

title: Gaza protests: The 60 days a Paris university was at the heart of the national political debate
summary: Sit-ins, blockades, tension and discussions. The Paris university has been the focal point of a student movement calling for an end to the war in Gaza.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Behind the scenes of negotiations for a ceasefire in Gaza
summary: The text submitted by Israel on April 27 had raised hopes of an agreement, which the American, Egyptian, and Qatari mediators have so far failed to achieve.

title: Champions League: Hummels stuns Mbappé and PSG to take Borussia Dortmund to final
summary: Hummels struck five minutes into the second half at the Parc des Princes and PSG were unable to muster a response. Dortmund won 1-0, on Tuesday.

title: Two women charged in France over graffiti on  'The Origin of the World' famous painting
summary: Two women were charged in France on Tuesday over the spraying of the words 'MeToo' on five artworks including a famous 19th-century painting of a woman's vulva, a prosecutor said.

title: At his inauguration, Vladimir Putin commits to a long-term confrontation with the West
summary: 'We look to the future with confidence,' said the Russian president as he began his fifth term in office at a ceremony in the Kremlin attended by the French ambassador.

title: Florida judge indefinitely postpones Trump classified documents trial
summary: The former president had been scheduled to go on trial on May 20 but District Judge Aileen Cannon said that was not possible because of the number of pre-trial motions before the court.

title: NBA: Minnesota center Rudy Gobert named Defensive Player of the Year for the fourth time
summary: Gobert has the trophies for 2018, 2019, 2021 and 2024. Victor Wembanyama finishes 2nd. The San Antonio rookie center was announced Monday as the league's Rookie of the Year.
